title: Levitical Cities Assigned
shortSummary: Joshua 21 details the allocation of cities to the Levites throughout the tribes of Israel, fulfilling God's command given through Moses. This chapter highlights God's faithfulness in providing for the priestly tribe and securing places of refuge, emphasizing the importance of obedience and divine provision.
timeline: c. 1406 BC - Conquest and settlement of Canaan under Joshua

keyCharacters.name: Eleazar the Priest
keyCharacters.description: The high priest who, alongside Joshua, oversees the distribution of cities to the Levites as commanded by the LORD.

keyCharacters.name: Joshua son of Nun
keyCharacters.description: Leader of Israel who administers the allotment of cities to the Levites, continuing Moses' work.

keyCharacters.name: The Levites
keyCharacters.description: The priestly tribe of Israel who receive cities to dwell in, as they have no tribal land inheritance.

keyCharacters.name: Caleb son of Jephunneh
keyCharacters.description: A faithful spy and warrior who receives the fields and villages of Hebron as his possession.

definitions.definition: Members of the tribe of Levi set apart for religious duties and service in the tabernacle, receiving cities rather than a contiguous tribal territory.
Designated cities where one who accidentally killed another could flee for protection until trial, ensuring justice and mercy.
The surrounding lands or pasture areas allocated along with the cities to provide for the Levites' livestock and livelihood.
A method used to determine God's will in dividing land, often by casting lots to ensure fairness and divine guidance.

outline.heading: Levites Request Cities
outline.description: The heads of the Levite families approach Eleazar, Joshua, and tribal leaders at Shiloh to remind them of God's command to provide cities for the Levites, who receive these cities from the Israelites' inheritance.

outline.heading: Allocation of Cities by Levitical Family
outline.description: The chapter details the distribution of cities to the three Levitical clans—Kohathites, Gershonites, and Merarites—across various tribes, including cities designated as cities of refuge.

outline.heading: Summary of Cities Given
outline.description: A comprehensive listing of the cities assigned to each Levitical family, emphasizing the fulfillment of God's command and the provision for the Levites throughout Israel.

outline.heading: God’s Faithfulness Confirmed
outline.description: The chapter concludes by affirming that God gave Israel all the promised land, granting them rest and victory over their enemies, with all His promises fulfilled.

application: Trust in God's provision as He faithfully supplies for His servants, just as He provided cities for the Levites.
Obey God's commands fully, knowing that His instructions lead to blessing and fulfillment of His promises.
Recognize the importance of spiritual service and dedication, exemplified by the Levites' role in Israel.
Seek refuge in God’s mercy and justice, remembering the cities of refuge as a picture of Christ’s protection for sinners.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD gave unto Israel all the land which he sware to give unto their fathers; and they possessed it, and dwelt therein.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God's faithfulness in fulfilling His covenant promises to Israel.

keyVerses.text: There failed not ought of any good thing which the LORD had spoken unto the house of Israel; all came to pass.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the complete reliability of God's word and His perfect fulfillment of promises.

keyVerses.text: And they spake unto them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, The LORD commanded by the hand of Moses to give us cities to dwell in, with the suburbs thereof for our cattle.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows the Levites’ reliance on God’s command and the importance of obedience to His instructions.
